body.directions: Listen to the audio, and then complete the multiple-choice questions that follow.

body.quiz: Which is another word that has the same meaning as the word in the audio?
body.correct: You got it! An alternative word for 乡村 xiāngcūn (countryside) is 乡下 xiāngxià (countryside), especially in spoken Chinese.
body.incorrect: Not quite. Review the vocabulary again, especially the notes, and then check the words in the choices very carefully. Look very closely as the shapes of the characters in the choices are very similar.

body.quiz: Which of the following sentences can be reasonably completed with the word presented?
body.answer: 我爷爷奶奶住在_____。Wǒ yéye nǎinai zhùzài_____.
options: 我今天晚餐要吃_____。Wǒ jīntiān wǎncān yào chī_____.
我家有院子和_____。Wǒjiā yǒu yuànzi hé _____.
我上数学课需要_____。Wò shàng shùxuékè xūyào_____.
body.correct: Job wonderfully done! 郊区 jiāoqū means “suburbs,” and it best completes the sentence: 我爷爷奶奶住在郊区。 Wǒ yéye nǎinai zhùzài jiāoqū. (My paternal grandparents live in the suburbs.)
body.incorrect: Not quite. Listen to the word again to understand its meaning. Then place it in the sentences in the choices, one by one, to see which one makes the most sense.

body.quiz: Which of the following items is least likely produced at the place indicated by the word in the audio?
body.answer: Audio for 衣服 yīfu (clothes)
options: Audio for 肉 ròu (meat)
Audio for 水果 shuǐguǒ (fruit) E
Audio for 蔬菜 shūcài (vegetable)
body.correct: Fantastic job! 农场 nóngchǎng means “farm,” where vegetables, fruits, or meats are produced, while clothes are more likely produced in a factory instead of a farm.
body.incorrect: Not quite. Listen to the word several more times to identify its meaning, and then listen to the audios in the choices to identify their meanings as well. Then consider which one is least likely produced at the place indicated in the question.

body.quiz: Which of the following does the place indicated in the audio mostly contain?
body.correct: Terrific job! 湖 hú means “lake,” and a lake mostly contains water. There might be a 山 shān (mountain) surrounding a lake, but not contained in it.
body.incorrect: So close! Listen to the word presented several more times to understand its meaning. Then consider its nature and what material it most likely contains.
